# leplot

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

leplot is to make charts in the Layman Economics blog style

## Installation

You can install the development version of leplot with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("miguelayalar/leplot")
```

## Example

This is a basic line chart example:

```{r example}
devtools::install_github("miguelayalar/leplot")
library(tidyverse)
library(leplot)
## basic example code

economics_long %>% 
  dplyr::select(-3) %>%
  rename(value = value01) %>%
  filter(variable %in% c('psavert', 'uempmed', 'unemploy')) %>% 
  leplot_line(a =., 
              ttl = "US macro variables",
              leg = c('Savings rate', 'Median Unemployed', 'Unemployed'),
              lh_units = "%", 
              x_range = c(2004, 2016), 
              y_range = c(0, 1, 0.2),
              leg_col = 1,
              rh_units = "pct",
              nudge_rh_units = 0.2,
              rhs_var = 'uempmed',
              y2_range = c(0, 1, 0.2),
              invert_axis = 0,
              thm = 'le_theme')

```
